description: Number of irreducible nonpositively curved triangulations of an n-gon: All internal vertices have at valence at least 6 and no diagonals of the n-gon are allowed.
links: G. Kuperberg, Spiders for rank 2 Lie algebras, arXiv:q-alg/9712003, 1997.
G. Kuperberg, Spiders for rank 2 Lie algebras, Comm. Math. Phys. 180 (1996), 109-151.
formula: The g.f. C(x) is derived from the g.f. B(x) of A060049 by B_1(x) = C_1(B_1(x))+x, where B_1(x) = B(x)/x and C_1(x) = C(x)/x.
example: c(8) = 5 = 1+4. We can divide the octagon into 8 pie slices and we can split any pair of opposite radii of this triangulation into two triangles.
author: _Greg Kuperberg_, Feb 15 2001
